3.0 out of 5 stars;A mixed bag. Not a 5.7 inch screen;"This phone is a mixed bag. On paper
column2: the specs look good and it seems to run fast. However
column3: the biggest issue that I have with the phone is its screen. Sony claims that the phone has a 5.7 inch screen. NOT TRUE. The useable screen is only 5.3 inch. So if you are looking for a 5.3 inch screen
column4: this may be your phone. If you need something bigger

column1: Currently own a Samsung Note 4. It has a true 5.7 inch screen. Measuring the width and the height of the screen you get about 7.1 x 12.6 cm = 89.46 sqcm of useable screen space. My iPhone 6s plus has 83.64 sqcm of screen space. And now this Sony XZ2 : 6.5 x 11.6 cm = 75.4 sqcm of usable screen space. You loose a lot of real estate. Can't afford this
column2: need this phone for business  to read documents
column4: etc. so I need to screen space.";M S Frank;29-Aug-18; ;phone

column1: 3.0 out of 5 stars;Marginal improvement from XZs;"Beware whom you get this phone from!!!
The more I use this phone
column2: the more I feel that this phone was a demo unit.

column1: - screen touch isn't responsive
- periodic lines appears when hands are warm
- auto brightness is close to not working
Updated thoughts:
I think xperia xz2 is generally a good phone. However
column2: after seeing the complaints
column3: it makes me wonder if third party sellers are getting their phones from defected batches from the manufacturers (not Sony). That's why they are much cheaper than the market value. I'll buy it from best buy directly to see if there are fewer issues.

column1: New found issue:
As many people would do after the screen is full of fingerprints and dusty
column2: we wipe it with cloth or our clothes. After that
column3: you will see very obvious horizontal lines due to ESD. Not sure if this is my phone or it's a general issue. I have to restart the phone to get rid of the lines.

column1: Also
column2: if you finger swipe quickly and create some static
column3: you will see the color gets darker... Very disappointed

column1: Upgraded from xperia xzs...
Have been a Sony fan... However
column2: somehow a bit disappointed by the phone. But let's start with the good stuff though:

column1: 1. Great LCD screen
column2: good color
column3: but light leakage is a bit worse than my xzs.

column1: 2. Good low light performance camera. However
column2: I think they over increased the pixel gain. As a result

column1: 3. Battery life is improved
column2: probably just because it's bigger.

column1: 4. Beautiful design (black) without a case
5. Speaker is louder
Now
column2: the bad stuff:

column1: 1. Fingerprint sensor location is awkward. After upgrading to Android 9
column2: it became less responsive and some Apps stopped working with the sensor.

column1: 2. Slippery without a case.
3. Nice haptic engine
column2: but the force is too small to feel when there is a phone call.

column1: 4. A bit on the heavier side as for the weight.
5. Pictures from the front camera are very nosiy
6. Sony needs to make a SW to stop all the Google stuff that's running in the background. That's why the bigger battery doesn't improve the user experience that much
7. Battery care option doesn't seem to work on my phone
My wish list for xz4...
1. Don't use oled... It's the stupidest technology... Shorter life time
column2: burn in problem... Maybe save the battery life marginally

column1: 2. Keep the fingerprint sensor on the Side!!! Under display fp sensor is overrated. People will see burn in in their oled with optical fp sensors
3. Make a better SW.
4. Have a option in the camera so that images are less noisy in normal lighting
5. If you want to do a glass back for wireless charge

column4: with the Usual Sprinkle of Pre-installed Crapware;"Great battery life is what I look for in every phone that I buy. This one lasts me 1.5 to 2 days on a full charge—and I usually only charge it up to 95%. The phone UI is pretty smooth. Even with battery time preferred STAMINA mode (which I keep on most of the time)

column1: I can’t say much about the camera other than that it takes pictures much better than the Xperia Z5 Compact that I have. The photos just come out with more detail. It’s not as good as SAMSUNG or Apple’s iPhone though—which is weird considering the fact that Sony makes great DSLRs and camera sensors.
A little warning for those who do not like pre-installed crapware: this phone is heavy on the Amazon pre-installed apps and Facebook which cannot be removed—only disabled. I use Amazon services
column2: but I do not want separate apps hogging storage space on my phone. I prefer the much less intrusive option of using a web browser. Among the list of crapware that I’ve had to disable: Amazon Shopping
column10: and Prime Video. At least they removed File Commander and Spotify (which were pre-installed on previous phones).";Kevin L.;13-Jun-18;https://www.amazon.com/Sony-Xperia-5-7-inches-Factory-Unlocked/product-reviews/B07BGXVDZP/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_show_all_btm?ie=UTF8&reviewerType=all_reviews;battery

5.0 out of 5 stars;Great phone with outstanding camera;"Great phone. I have it since a couple of months and I will buy another one for my wife. The camera is the most important feature on a smartphone for me and in this point it is probably the best device on the market right now.
I compared photos from the same scene from an iPhone X and a S9+ and the Sony brings higher resolution and better colors even in low light conditions.
What also convinced me was the display
column2: which beats Apple and Samsung in max. brightness. It's not an OLED display which means less contrast and a noticeable black level but it has a higher color fidelity and more natural colors
column3: which I find more important (personal opinion).

column1: On the negative side it is a little thicker and heavier than the competitors.
The build quality of the phone is great and it feels very solid. Some people complain about the location of the finger print reader
column2: which I can't understand. I have no problems finding it and it works great.

column1: All in all the flagship phones are all very close together and the decision to choose one over the other is down to details. I had Sony and Samsung phones before. Here the decision was for the camera and that the Sony phones I had so far were a little more stable in software and survived very long even so I don't treat my phones very carefully.";xSTONE;29-Jul-18;https://www.amazon.com/Sony-Xperia-5-7-inches-Factory-Unlocked/product-reviews/B07BGXVDZP/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_show_all_btm?ie=UTF8&reviewerType=all_reviews;phone
